pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: :v: urkud can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7793970868/job/21254537131)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7793970868/job/21254536885)

Could you also move `snorm_le_snorm_top_mul_snorm` and `snorm_le_snorm_mul_snorm_top` around here? These are particular cases of the next inequalities when one exponent is infinite, so it would feel strange to separate them.
Could you rename this file to `MeasureTeory.Function.LpSeminorm.Basic`?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(LpSeminorm): further split the file
